data.title: Show default property values in the editor
data.body: Plaese make it possible to see the default value of a property in the editor. In addition it would be great to be able to reset it to its default using a hotkey or button.

data.title: MSG (3d) ScalarFunction problem [1.1rc1]
data.body: I have texture blend where I use scalarFunction. If I set up SinH, CosH or TanH for ScalarFunction, 3d model disappear. I have old material shader from beta, where I use TanH and it was working without problem. And If i set up Frac in ScalarFunction, all textures are disappear and model get grey color - in this case i am not shure if it is bug, but i get grey model in onther case where i not use textures.

data.title: MSG (3d) texture options (Flag) problems
data.body:
_Bugsquad edit:_ Seen initially in 1.1 rc1.

I make repeat texture in Material Shader Graph editor. For that i must load same texture in Shader param and in edit mode turn on repeat option. In shader graph editor Edit mode dont work? If I click on edit, nothing happen. This is maybe second problem. The more big problem is, options under Flag in texture edit: mipmaps, repeat, filter, anisotropic etc.. are not saved. If I change repeat turn on, and save material and scene, after reload, the repeat option is turned off.

data.title: MSG (3d) Vector Uniform problem [1.1rc1]
data.body: In Material Shader Graph (3D) editor Fragment and Vertex, after add Vector Unform, all textures and effects are disapear and model get shade color.

data.title: Tripleclick now doesn't select line if clicks was done on different lines. Fix #1727
[Feature Request] (area), and (area 2D), no layers.
data.body: The forum here (http://www.godotengine.org/forum/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=1911&p=9138#p9138), as a result of the conversation found out that (area 2D) and (area) do not have the properties of layers it is so obvious that they are would be there in demand.

data.title: currently-selected editor tab is saved in the scene file
data.body:
The currently-selected editor tab get saved into each scene. Example:

``` diff
diff --git a/jstest.xscn b/jstest.xscn
index f38d216..6507dbb 100644
--- a/jstest.xscn
+++ b/jstest.xscn
@@ -165,7 +165,7 @@
                                <resource  resource_type="Script" path="res://jstest.gd">  </resource>
                                <dictionary  shared="false">
                                        <string> "__editor_plugin_screen__" </string>
-                                       <string> "Script" </string>
+                                       <string> "2D" </string>
                                        <string> "__editor_plugin_states__" </string>
                                        <dictionary  shared="false">
                                                <string> "2D" </string>
```

If you save the file on the Script tab, it changes the scene file, but it doesn't automatically return you to the Script tab when you re-open the scene in the editor.

What is the intended behavior?

data.title: Sort xml files, so order is constant
data.body: Makes xml format work better with version control systems. Mostly fixes #473. There are still some reorder problems left, e.g. with fonts, but mostly the xml is remaining the same. Of course, if this gets applied, there will be some changes due to sorting, but after that the order won't change.

data.title: Analysis of Godot Engine's Source Code by PVS-Studio static code analyzer
data.body:
Development team of proprietary PVS-Studio C/C++ static analyzer presents their report on the source code of Godot engine in the article, which contains the review of the most suspicious code fragments they discovered.

You can read article on the official site:
http://www.viva64.com/en/b/0321/

data.title: Dragging WindowDialog around causes resizing (ratio anchoring)
data.body:
This may relate to #369
https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/issues/369
I have a WindowDialog.
Anchor is (ratio,ratio,ratio,ratio)

I run the app, and drag the window around the screen and off screen. I grab it from the title bar.
The window seems to resize, even larger than the screen at some instances.
Notice while dragging the title bar, the title will lag behind and no longer be at the exact position of the mouse.

data.title: built in input state tracking
data.body:
is_action_pressed() should be able to return an integer corresponding to the input state, without breaking backwards-compatibility. For example, if 0 was NOT_PRESSED, 1 is JUST_PRESSED, 2 is PRESSED, and 3 is JUST_RELEASED. (You'd get the 3 only for one frame I'd imagine, when releasing the button. It shouldn't actually affect anything that is just treating the function as boolean).

@ndee85 has a GDScript which does something similar to this, but it'd be better if it were built in and standardized.

data.title: touchScreenButton should emit released when deleted
data.body:
After touchScreenButton.queue_free() + hold button, godot is still emitting press signal

https://yadi.sk/d/3VxvO2RNgLTn8 (here is apk and problem project)

ps - 25 april build (1.1beta1 templates)

data.title: Questions on plugin / extension system
data.body:
On the wiki, there is a slashed "Editor Plugin"
Does it means the feature exist now? 

How does the plugin system work?

The Plugins you planned exist as c++ codes and need compile? Or as gdscript executed at runtime(like Unity)?

The Godot editor is distributed in a single exe file (win64 for example). Without exposing the inner file structure, where to put those plugin files?

I would like to create an extension, to export objects on stage to a file,maybe xml, for use in other game engine. (Godot will only be a scene editor  in this workflow). Can I do thatï¼Ÿ How can I do that?

data.title: body_enter sometimes don't report contact collisions
data.body:
I made this project to show the bug.
https://github.com/guilhermefelipecgs/bug_in_body_enter

When the rigid body collide with the static body, rigid body is destroyed, but sometimes fails.

His problem happens when I move the character and he collides first with the "wall " and then with the "ground" in a short time.

data.title: Fix headless exporting bugs
data.body:
fixes two bugs. Firs one: on first run (when the config directory can't be found and one with the defaults is created), we don't set the settings variable. This leads headless exporting for android search for the template apk under `/` and not inside the  `~/.godot/` directory.

The second bug was that if configuration fails, e.g. because that said apk can't be found, the application neither prints an error nor exits. Instead, it hangs.

data.title: Problem after importing projects from 1.0 to 1.1 beta 1.
data.body: I noticed when I opened the project (kinematic_char) 3D in 1.1 beta1 that cubes lifts and mushroom on top of the level, completely invisible at first I thought they were gone completely, but then faced with an invisible platform lift, and it works just invisible mesh (is not visible in any editor or in the running scene), also have a problem with (3D particles) of materials no longer work there, and the particles look like simple white squares, I spent testing on different computers this occurs everywhere the same.

data.title: Port collision layer/mask system from 2D to 3D to improve collision filtering
data.body:
**Bugsquad edit:** This feature was added to the 2D engine as stated below, but not yet to the 3D engine.

   Sometimes it is necessary to make objects of the same type that don't collide with each other but collide with other objects in a world. For example bullets or enemies that should collide with player but should not collide with each other. Right now it is difficult to achieve such behaviour in godot.
   It would be handy to have collision masks to specify with what layers object can collide, like it is done for example in Box2d or Bullet,

   http://bulletphysics.org/mediawiki-1.5.8/index.php/Collision_Filtering  (example a bit outdated, see notes on the page)
   www.box2d.org/manual.html#_Toc258082972   (scroll down a bit to see 'Filtering' section). 

   Both engines allow collisions only when Object1 allows collision with Object2 and Object2 allows collision with Object1. 
if ((layerA & maskB) != 0 && (layerB & maskA) != 0) { ...collision... }

data.title: Dynamic preload
data.body:
It could be useful to preload classes dynamically.

At present :

``` GDScript
var s = "A.gd"
var t = preload(s) # Parser Error: Expecting string constant as preload argument
```

Example:

``` GDScript
var s = ["A.gd", "B.gd", "C.gd"] # could be generated dynamically with Directory
for i in s:
    Globals.set(i.replace(".gd",""), preload(i))
```

data.title: godot -export Android doesn't show any error if not properly configured
data.body: When you run `godot -export Android` in the command line (only tested headless version), and exporting isn't set up properly, there is no error shown, godot only hangs without doing anything. There should a list of errors like in the export dialog of the editor.

data.title: Broadcast signal
data.body:
in this state of godot you can emit_signal just for a node.but signaling should broadcast to all nodes in scene and if some node connect to that signal the method should be called. 
I read c++ and signal is using in object, we should have a signal manager that store all signals and nodes that connected to this signal and be called when broadcast is called.
I can implement it just give me the green light if this is ok.

data.title: Joypad changes undetected on Windows
data.body:
Godot doesnt detect if gamepads are connected or disconnected on windows ( I'm using up to date 7 Pro ) at all in runtime. The only way to get gamepads work well is to connect them before running the game itself.
joy_connection_changed signal doesn't detect any changes too. However everything works great on Ubuntu 14.01.
I've checked it on different Godot versions ( down to official beta 1.0 ) - without any luck.
Would love to see it fixed =]
